intro: Burnatastrum lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf burnet. It is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae, characterized by its dense clusters of small, pinkish-red flowers. The plant is native to North America and thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Burnatastrum lanceolatum is also known for its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
